title: Former Minister Rajitha Senaratne likely to be named suspect
byline: The Bribery Commission informed the court that former Fisheries Minister Rajitha Senaratne is likely to be named as a suspect in connection with the controversial sand dredging project at the Kirinda Fisheries Harbour.

title: Tourists on the ropes - PHOTO
byline: Sri Lanka was poised for an early kill against Bangladesh at the end of day three in the second Test at the SSC ground. In their second essay, Bangladesh faced with the task of erasing a 211-run deficit, were in tatters struggling on 115 for six when bad light stopped play.

title: Israel extends re-entry visas for Sri Lankan workers amid Middle East unrest
byline: In response to the ongoing instability in the Middle East, the Population and Immigration Authority (PIBA) of Israel has extended the validity of re-entry visas for individuals who returned to Sri Lanka with plans to resume employment in Israel.

title: White House wants deep cut in US funding for war crimes investigations, sources say
byline: The White House has recommended terminating U.S. funding for nearly two dozen programs that conduct war crimes and accountability work globally, including in Myanmar, Syria and on alleged Russian atrocities in Ukraine, according to three U.S. sources familiar with the matter and internal government documents reviewed by Reuters.

title: Trump says he would ’absolutely’ consider bombing Iran again
byline: US President Donald Trump has said he would ’’absolutely’’ consider bombing Iran again.

title: Rise in social media scams targeting Sri Lankans: CID warns public
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has raised alarm over a sharp increase in crimes targeting Sri Lankans through popular social media platforms such as Facebook, WhatsApp, Telegram, Skype and WeChat.

title: US Supreme Court ruling expands Trump’s power and he intends to use it
byline: The Supreme Court on Friday handed a significant victory to Donald Trump - and future American presidents - when curbing lower courts’ power to block executive orders.

title: MasterChef Sri Lanka cooks up local debut
byline: MasterChef Sri Lanka is set to make its television debut as the 71st international adaptation of the globally acclaimed culinary franchise, the producers announced this week, positioning the show as a premium offering in the island’s reality TV space.

title: Largest FDI under NPP govt. still in limbo
byline: The $ 3.7 billion investment project by Sinopec in Hambantota - the largest ever Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) in Sri Lanka - is still in limbo even after the lapse of six months because of differences between the government and the company on the local market share component, Daily Mirror learns.

title: SL failed to capitalise on strategic location: Verite Research
byline: Despite decades of celebrating its strategic position, Sri Lanka has fundamentally failed to capitalise on its prime location, a critical factor that remains the key to unlocking its potential as a developed nation, asserted prominent economist and Verite Research Research Director Subhashini Abeysinghe.

title: India’s Mazagon Dock to acquire control of Colombo Dockyard for US $ 52.96mn
byline: India’s Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders Ltd has agreed to buy a controlling stake in Sri Lanka’s Colombo Dockyard PLC for up to US $ 52.96 million, the companies said.

title: Insurers urged to innovate with low-cost products for universal Sri Lankan coverage
byline: A senior insurance leader has urged the Sri Lankan insurance industry to shift its focus from incremental growth and develop low-cost, accessible products to pursue universal coverage for the entire nation.

title: US Supreme Court allows parents to opt out of lessons with LGBT books
byline: The US Supreme Court has sided with parents in the state of Maryland who wanted to opt their children out of reading books with LGBTQ themes.

title: Seat belt rule for bus drivers compulsory from July 1
byline: The National Transport Commission (NTC) announced that starting July 1, 2025, it will be compulsory for all bus drivers to wear seat belts, with strict penalties for non-compliance.

title: Four MPs get stuck in BMICH elevator
byline: Four Members of Parliament who are following a study course in governance at the Bandaranaike  Memorial International Conference Hall (BMICH) were stuck in an elevator while coming down from the study hall.

title: Police Commission approves appointing Shani Abeysekera as CID Director
byline: The National Police Commission has approved the appointment of SSP Shani Abeysekera as Director of the Criminal Investigation Department (CID).

title: Pharmaceutical Society of Sri Lanka holds 43rd Annual General Meeting tomorrow
byline: The Pharmaceutical Society of Sri Lanka (PSSL) announced its flagship event, the 43rd Annual General Meeting and the Scientific Sessions 2025, and the award ceremony which will be held on June 29, 2025 at Waters Edge, Battaramulla.

title: Government to strengthen public transport system to elevate country to new level: President
byline: The government is placing particular emphasis on strengthening the public transport system as part of its broader agenda to elevate the country to a new level, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said.

title: Najmul Hossain Shanto steps down as Test captain
byline: Following Bangladesh’s crushing defeat to Sri Lanka in the second Test in Colombo, Najmul Hossain Shanto has announced his decision to step down as the Test captain.

title: Sri Lanka wraps up series with dominant innings win over Bangladesh
byline: Sri Lanka won the second Test against Bangladesh by an innings and 78 runs on Saturday, a comfortable victory that saw the host clinch the series.

title: Airforce deploys helicopter, Y-12 aircraft in search for missing fishermen in Galle, Kalutara
byline: The Sri Lanka Air Force deployed a Bell 412 helicopter and a Y-12 aircraft to search for six missing fishermen off the Galle and Kalutara coasts.
